sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"欢迎，致敬，致意，招呼"之意。
means: address ：侧重打招呼的方式或指所使用的称谓。
greet ：常指友好而热诚地欢迎。
salute ：正式用词，指用敬礼、亲吻或挥帽等动作向他人致意或问候，尤指以某种礼节欢迎某人。
hail ：主要指怀着敬意欢迎某人，侧重欢快轻松和嘈杂。也指隔得较远的高声招呼。
welcome ：多指热情的官方的或正式的迎接或欢迎，但也指一般的欢迎。

sentence.Network_en: He looked at Livy and Mark, who had risen to greet him.
sentence.Network_cn: 他看着站起来跟他打招呼的莉薇和马克。

sentence.Network_en: They hastened to greet him and asked urgently, "Did you find it?"
sentence.Network_cn: 他们赶忙去迎他，急切地问，“找到了吗？”

sentence.Network_en: An unerringly professional team greet and treat clients.
sentence.Network_cn: 完美的职业团队迎接并善待客户。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English grētan 'approach, attack, or salute', of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch groeten and German grüssen 'greet'
Old English, partly from grētan 'cry out, rage', partly from grēotan 'lament', both of Germanic origin

entry.tran: 同…打招呼;向…问好；欢迎；迎接
entry.def: When you greet someone, you say 'Hello' or shake hands with them.

example.ex: She liked to be home to greet Steve when he came in from school.
example.tran: 她喜欢呆在家里迎接放学回家的史蒂夫。

entry.def: If something is greeted in a particular way, people react to it in that way.

example.ex: The European Court's decision has been greeted with dismay by fishermen...
example.tran: 渔民对欧洲法庭的裁决感到失望。

example.ex: It is unlikely that this suggestion will be greeted enthusiastically in the Baltic States.
example.tran: 该提议不大可能在波罗的海诸国得到热烈响应。

entry.tran: 呈现在…面前；映入…眼帘；最先被…感觉到
entry.def: If you are greeted by something, it is the first thing you notice in a particular place.

example.ex: I was greeted by a shocking sight...
example.tran: 一幅令人震惊的画面映入我的眼帘。

example.ex: The savoury smell greeted them as they went through the door.
example.tran: 他们进门时一阵香味扑鼻而来。

means.word_mean: 3. react to in a certain way;

sentences.sentence: "Loud music greeted him when he entered the apartment"

auth_sentence.content: We can greet our friends, families and relatives.
auth_sentence.res_content: We can greet our friends, families and relatives.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We can greet our friends, families and relatives.

auth_sentence.content: To greet mine own land with my wishful sight.
auth_sentence.res_content: To greet mine own land with my wishful sight.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: To greet mine own land with my wishful sight.

auth_sentence.content: He smiles and gets up slowly to greet her.
auth_sentence.res_content: He smiles and gets up slowly to greet her.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He smiles and gets up slowly to greet her.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 致敬,问候;欢迎;反应;被……所感知
stems_affixes.word_buile: greet问候,迎接→ v.致敬,问候;欢迎;反应;被……所感知

Sentence.sentence: If he keeps the palm of the hand parallel to the floor, as he would in his own culture when making known the height of a child, for example, he will very likely be greeted by laughter, in Colombia this gesture is reserved for the description of animals.
Yet each of these other forms of greeting is appropriate in other parts of the world.

means.word_mean: 欢迎, 迎接, 致意, 问候

sentences.en: The host greeted us at the gate.
sentences.cn: 主人在大门口迎接我们。

jushi.english: She went on working after she greeted me.
jushi.chinese: 她跟我打了声招呼,又接着干自己的事儿。

jushi.english: When I reached the top of the mountain, a splendid view greeted my eyes.
jushi.chinese: 当我到达山顶,一幅壮丽的景色映入我的眼帘。

jushi.english: Leonora was still crying when unexpected visitors arrived; gulping back her tears, she made an effort to greet them cheerfully.
jushi.chinese: 当有人突然来访时,利奥诺拉还在哭,她强忍着泪水,努力作出高兴的样子来接待他们。
